The plants are native to various regions in Europe and Asia, often growing in grassy areas or along woodland edges. Hypolobus species are perennial herbs with slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
